channel.title: Homes on Damaris Zurell research
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Damaris Zurell research

item.description: The biodiversity modelling lab I am fascinated by the question why species and individuals are where they are, how they get there and how they manage to sustain. This is central to understanding how they will respond to changes in their abiotic and biotic environment, for example due to climate change. In my team, we tackle research questions across several spatial and temporal scales. For example, we study drivers of broad-scale species distributions, of population dynamics as well as individual fitness, and their interplay with inter- and intraspecific interactions and life-history trade-offs.

item.title: People
item.description: For opportunities to join the lab, please have a look here. Lab head: Damaris Zurell (PhD) - Junior research group leader at HU Berlin (temporary) Postdocs: 2018-2019 - Patrice Descombes (PhD) - SPEEDMIND project, Improving biodiversity analyses and citizen science feedback through data mining approaches. Based at WSL with Niklaus E Zimmermann 2018-2021 - Guillermo Fandos Guzman (PhD) - BIOPIC project, work package “Understanding how life history and environment shape dispersal in birds”

item.title: Publications
item.description: You can find a full list of my publications here. My ResearcherID is E-2439-2012. You can also find me on ResearchGate and GoogleScholar.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Coordinator of MSc module “Global change impacts on biodiversity”, HU Berlin, since 2018 Co-advisor in course “Spatial modelling: From climate & land use change to biodiversity conservation”, ETH Zürich, autumn semesters 2016 and 2017 Lecturer within block course “Macroecology, niche evolution and climate change”, University of Zurich, autumn semester 2014 Visiting lecturer for block course “Introduction to data analysis in R for geographers”, University of Tübingen, winter semester 2012-2013 Co-advisor in block course “Advanced ecological modelling”, University of Potsdam, winter semester 2012-2013 Co-advisor in block course “Introduction to ecological modelling”, University of Potsdam, summer semester 2011 Lecturer for seminar “Simulation methods in Hydrology and Geoecology”, University of Potsdam, winter semester 2008-2009 Lecturer for seminar “Landscape Ecology”, University of Potsdam, summer semester 2007

item.title: Downloads
item.description: You can download some of my codes from my github site.
